social_conversations.title: Meeting Someone New

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Hi! What's your name?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: My name is Ana. And you?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: I'm Carlos. Nice to meet you.

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: Likewise. Where are you from?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: I'm from the United States. And you?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: I'm from here, from Madrid.

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.spanish: ¡Qué interesante! ¿Tienes tiempo para tomar un café?
dialogue.english: How interesting! Do you have time for a coffee?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: Yes, of course. Let's go.

social_conversations.tips: Use 'Mucho gusto' when meeting someone. 'Igualmente' means 'likewise'.

social_conversations.title: Small Talk About Weather

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: What a beautiful day!

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: Yes, the weather is very nice.

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Is it always so sunny here?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: En verano, sí. Pero en invierno llueve mucho.
dialogue.english: In summer, yes. But in winter it rains a lot.

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: I love the sun.

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: A mí también. ¿Te gusta la playa?
dialogue.english: Me too. Do you like the beach?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Yes, I love to swim.

social_conversations.tips: 'Hace buen tiempo' = nice weather. 'Hace mal tiempo' = bad weather.

social_conversations.title: Talking About Hobbies

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
dialogue.english: What do you like to do in your free time?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: Me gusta leer y ver películas. ¿Y a ti?
dialogue.english: I like to read and watch movies. And you?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.spanish: Me encanta jugar al fútbol y tocar la guitarra.
dialogue.english: I love to play soccer and play the guitar.

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: How cool! Do you play in a band?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.spanish: No, solo por diversión. ¿Qué tipo de películas te gustan?
dialogue.english: No, just for fun. What kind of movies do you like?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: Me gustan las comedias y las películas de acción.
dialogue.english: I like comedies and action movies.

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.spanish: A mí también. Deberíamos ir al cine algún día.
dialogue.english: Me too. We should go to the movies someday.

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: Yes, I'd love to!

social_conversations.tips: Use 'me gusta' + infinitive verb for activities you like.

social_conversations.title: Making Plans with Friends

dialogue.speaker: friend1
dialogue.spanish: ¿Qué planes tienes para el fin de semana?
dialogue.english: What plans do you have for the weekend?

dialogue.speaker: friend2
dialogue.english: I don't have plans yet. Why?

dialogue.speaker: friend1
dialogue.spanish: ¿Quieres ir a la playa el sábado?
dialogue.english: Do you want to go to the beach on Saturday?

dialogue.speaker: friend2
dialogue.english: Yes! What time?

dialogue.speaker: friend1
dialogue.spanish: ¿Te parece bien a las diez de la mañana?
dialogue.english: Is ten in the morning okay with you?

dialogue.speaker: friend2
dialogue.english: Perfect. Where should we meet?

dialogue.speaker: friend1
dialogue.spanish: En la estación de metro. ¿Te viene bien?
dialogue.english: At the metro station. Does that work for you?

dialogue.speaker: friend2
dialogue.spanish: Sí, perfecto. Nos vemos el sábado.
dialogue.english: Yes, perfect. See you Saturday.

dialogue.speaker: friend1
dialogue.english: See you Saturday!

social_conversations.tips: '¿Te parece bien?' = Does that seem good to you? Use for making suggestions.

social_conversations.title: At a Party - Mingling

dialogue.speaker: host
dialogue.english: Welcome! Come in, please.

dialogue.speaker: guest
dialogue.spanish: Gracias por invitarnos. Esta es mi amiga Laura.
dialogue.english: Thanks for inviting us. This is my friend Laura.

dialogue.speaker: host
dialogue.spanish: Mucho gusto, Laura. La comida está en la cocina.
dialogue.english: Nice to meet you, Laura. The food is in the kitchen.

dialogue.speaker: guest
dialogue.english: Do you know many people here?

dialogue.speaker: laura
dialogue.spanish: No, es mi primera vez. ¿Y tú?
dialogue.english: No, it's my first time. And you?

dialogue.speaker: guest
dialogue.english: I know the host from work.

dialogue.speaker: laura
dialogue.spanish: Ah, entiendo. La música está muy bien.
dialogue.english: Ah, I understand. The music is very good.

dialogue.speaker: guest
dialogue.english: Yes, do you want something to drink?

dialogue.speaker: laura
dialogue.english: Yes, thanks. Let's go.

social_conversations.tips: Social phrases: 'Pasen' (Come in), 'Bienvenidos' (Welcome), 'Mucho gusto' (Nice to meet you).

social_conversations.title: Asking About Someone's Day

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Hi, how was your day?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: Bien, gracias. Un poco cansado. ¿Y el tuyo?
dialogue.english: Good, thanks. A bit tired. And yours?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Very busy. I had a lot of work.

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.english: I can imagine. Do you want to rest a bit?

dialogue.speaker: person1
dialogue.english: Yes, good idea. Shall we have something?

dialogue.speaker: person2
dialogue.spanish: Claro, vamos a tomar un café.
dialogue.english: Sure, let's have a coffee.

social_conversations.tips: '¿Cómo estuvo?' is past tense. '¿Cómo está?' is present tense.
